definitions.definition: A performer who understudies; a standby.
To study or know a role to such an extent as to be able to replace the normal performer when required.
To act as an understudy (to someone).
To act in a similar manner to some known person.
An energetic particle originating outside our solar system.
Cosmic radiation: a stream of cosmic rays.
A tradesman who installs, repairs and maintains electrical wiring and equipment.
A scientist who studies electricity.
A musical instrument consisting of a flat sounding box with numerous strings placed on a horizontal surface, played with a plectrum or fingertips.
(translations) Related or similar instruments in other cultures, such as the Chinese guqin or Norwegian harpeleik; especially any chordophone without a neck, and with strings that pass over the body.
To play a zither.
To make a sound similar to that made by a zither; to move while making such a sound.
A drawn-out period where the weather has been dry, for an abnormally long time; shorter and not as severe as a drought.
A period or time where there is little activity, productivity, low income etc.
A period of time without sexual intercourse.

A communication from a bank to a person holding an account in that bank, usually issued monthly, detailing the value of the holdings in that account and the effects of all transactions occurring with respect to that account.
(of clothing) Fitting closely to the body of the wearer, thus clearly revealing its shape.
definitions.example: a form-fitting evening dress

definitions.definition: A delicacy (in taste).
Esteem, honour.
(Prairies and northwestern Ontario) A fancy cookie, pastry, or square, typically homemade, served at a social event (usually plural).
An affectionate term of address.
Excellent; valuable, fine.
Elegant; delicately small and pretty.
Fastidious and fussy, especially when eating.
A vote made remotely, especially a postal vote, cast by a voter unable to be present in person.
A broad prehistoric period during which humans widely used stone for toolmaking.
Any extremely primitive or undeveloped era.
definitions.example: If they attack our country, we'll bomb them back to the Stone Age!

definitions.definition: The time a particular field was introduced and was in its earliest stages of development.
A person employed to collect refuse from people's homes and take it to be processed.
The leaf of the curry tree, Murraya koenigii, which is used in Indian and Thai cooking (but not in curry powder).
The most important person in an organization.

Leaves of the tea plant which are treated with steam or roasted to denature the enzymes that cause the leaves to darken and change taste. (Without this step they would become oolong tea or black tea).
A beverage brewed from green tea leaves.
To make brighter or clearer; to illuminate.
definitions.example: to lighten an apartment with lamps or gas; to lighten the streets

definitions.definition: To become brighter or clearer; to brighten.
To burst forth or dart, as lightning; to shine with, or like, lightning; to flash.
To emit or disclose in, or as if in, lightning; to flash out, like lightning.
To illuminate with knowledge; to enlighten.
To alleviate; to reduce the burden of.
definitions.example: Sorrow can be lightened by being openly brought out.

definitions.definition: To make light or lighter in weight.
To make less serious or more cheerful.
To become light or lighter in weight.
To become less serious or more cheerful.
To descend; to light.
Not occupied; empty.
Showing no intelligence or interest.
definitions.example: a vacant stare

definitions.definition: To become very angry and irrational.
definitions.example: The guy went ballistic when I tried to tell him he couldn't return the socks if the package had been opened.

definitions.definition: For a usually rocket powered, predominantly non-glide projectile or aerial vehicle, such as a ballistic missile, to travel to its target partly via unpowered ballistic or quasi-ballistic flight, usually following burnout of its rocket motor
For a powered, usually guided missile or other aerial vehicle to travel on an unguided or ballistic trajectory, having lost power, control or guidance
A hairstyle for women that is somewhere between a bob and a shingle.
To arrange the hair in this style.
A base hit in which the batter stops safely at first base.
To achieve a base hit in which the batter stops safely at first base.
Disappointingly inadequate.
definitions.example: He received a dismal compensation.

definitions.definition: Gloomy and bleak.
definitions.example: The storm made for a dismal weekend

definitions.definition: Depressing.
definitions.example: She was lost in dismal thoughts of despair

definitions.definition: Any of various large, venomous rays, of the orders Rajiformes and Myliobatiformes, having a barbed, whiplike tail.
A device that simulates a cell tower, used to intercept cell phone communications.
A horse of western North America that is wild or not fully broken.
One who has the tenure of a croft, usually also the occupant and user.
A Jewish folk musician.
A type of popular Jewish folk music especially associated with Ashkenazi cultures.
An athletic contest consisting of ten events which includes sprinting, hurdling, jumping, and throwing over a span of two days.
A contest in science and math proving skill.
A temple tower of the ancient Mesopotamian valley, having the form of a terraced pyramid of successively receding stories
A building with similar style or shape
definitions.example: He works in an old ziggurat of an office building.

definitions.definition: Worthy of respect; respectable.

A courtesy title, given in Britain and the Commonwealth to a cabinet minister, minister of state, or senator, and in the United States to the president, vice president, congresspeople, state governors and legislators, and mayors.
A unit of electrical power, in an AC circuit, equal to the power dissipated when 1 volt produces a current of 1 ampere.
Something that is variable.
Something whose value may be dictated or discovered.
definitions.example: There are several variables to consider here.

definitions.definition: A quantity that may assume any one of a set of values.
A symbol representing a variable.
A named memory location in which a program can store intermediate results and from which it can read them.
A variable star.
A shifting wind, or one that varies in force.
(in the plural) Those parts of the sea where a steady wind is not expected, especially the parts between the trade-wind belts.
The act of varying or the state of being variable.
A difference between what is expected and what is observed; deviation.
The state of differing or being in conflict.
An official permit to do something that is ordinarily forbidden by regulations.
A discrepancy between two legal documents.
A departure from a cause of action originally in a complaint.
The second central moment in probability.
The number of degrees of freedom in a system.
Covariance and contravariance generally.
definitions.example: Depending on the variance of the type constructor, the subtyping relation of the simple types may be either preserved, reversed, or ignored for the respective complex types.

definitions.definition: To put (someone) into a required psychological frame of mind (also psych up).
To intimidate (someone) emotionally or using psychology (also psych out).
To treat (someone) using psychoanalysis.
Thrilled.
Frightened.
Excited for a particular subject or interest.
definitions.example: She's psyched about the trip.

definitions.definition: Material (such as clothing, makeup, a wig) used to alter one’s visual appearance in order to hide one's identity or assume another.
definitions.example: A cape and moustache completed his disguise.

definitions.definition: The appearance of something on the outside which masks what's beneath.
The act of disguising, notably as a ploy.
definitions.example: Any disguise may expose soldiers to be deemed enemy spies.

definitions.definition: A change of behaviour resulting from intoxication.
To change the appearance of (a person or thing) so as to hide, or to assume an identity.
definitions.example: Spies often disguise themselves.

definitions.definition: To avoid giving away or revealing (something secret); to hide by a false appearance.
definitions.example: He disguised his true intentions.

definitions.definition: To affect or change by liquor; to intoxicate.
The practice of taking advantage of any situations or people to achieve an end, often with no regard for principles or consequences.
A work of art relating or dedicated to the night.
A dreamlike or pensive composition, usually for the piano.
To excommunicate; curse.
A house inhabited by the minister of a parish.
A family dwelling, an owner-occupied house.
A large house, a mansion.
(grammar) An article that introduces a noun and specifies it as the particular noun that is being considered; in English, the only definite article is the.
A shirt, typically loose and reaching from the neck to the waist.
A shirt for women, particularly a shirt with buttons; a dress shirt tailored for women.
A loose-fitting uniform jacket.
To hang a garment in loose folds.
To tuck one's pants/trousers (into one's boots).
A prostitute.
A prostitute; a courtesan.
A ruddy, fat-faced woman; a wench.
Any of several Greek dishes such as kalamaki, giros, kebab and shawarma.
A wrapped pancake dish filled with meat, salad and some kind of sauce or dressing, commonly called a kebab.
A song, in any folk style, originating among ordinary people, usually non-professional musicians, and handed down by oral tradition.
A song in the style of folk music, a modern genre of popular music.
A dead body.
definitions.example: Drive over the [expletive] corpses! Or we're not letting you in!

definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) A human body in general, whether living or dead.
(of an actor) To lose control during a performance and laugh uncontrollably.
A police section specializing in fraud.
An individual headlight, particularly of a motor vehicle.
A flashlight worn on the head.
Any of various of rice-based dishes common in Louisiana Cajun or Creole cooking; most often with shrimp, oysters, chicken or ham.
A Molotov cocktail

(grammar) A verbal form that functions as a verbal noun. (In English, a gerund has the same spelling as a present participle, but functions differently; however, this distinction may be ambiguous or unclear and so is no longer made in some modern texts such as A Comprehensive Grammar of the English Language and The Cambridge Grammar of the English Language)

(grammar) In some languages such as Dutch, Italian or Russian, a verbal form similar to a present participle, but functioning as an adverb to form adverbial phrases or continuous tense. These constructions have various names besides gerund, depending on the language, such as conjunctive participles, active participles, adverbial participles, transgressives, etc.
To make a living; earn money for necessities.
definitions.example: It is difficult to provide for my family working on minimum wage.

definitions.definition: To act to prepare for something.
definitions.example: Provide against disaster.

definitions.definition: To establish as a previous condition; to stipulate.
definitions.example: I'll lend you the money, provided that you pay it back by Monday.

definitions.definition: To give what is needed or desired, especially basic needs.
definitions.example: Don't bother bringing equipment, as we will provide it.

definitions.definition: To furnish (with), cause to be present.
To make possible or attainable.
definitions.example: He provides us with an alternative option.

definitions.definition: (Latinism) To foresee.
To appoint to an ecclesiastical benefice before it is vacant. See provisor.
Only if (the stipulation that follows is true).
definitions.example: You can go to the party provided you finish all your homework first.

definitions.definition: The characteristic cry or bleating of a sheep.
To make the characteristic cry of a sheep.
The characteristic cry of a sheep.
The letter ب in the Arabic script.

A marine mollusc, of the family Nautilidae native to the Pacific Ocean and Indian Ocean, which has tentacles and a spiral shell with a series of air-filled chambers, of which Nautilus is the type genus.
A kind of diving bell that sinks or rises by means of compressed air.
A one-piece, skin-tight garment rather like a leotard.
A feeling of grief or loss, especially after a failed romantic relationship.
That may be ascribed a date or age.
Suitable for dating (romantic outings).
A kind of protective charm or ornament, often bearing magical symbols, worn for protection against ill will, negative influences or evil spirits.
Rhyming verse (poetic form)
definitions.example: Many editors say they don't want stories written in rhyme.

definitions.definition: A thought expressed in verse; a verse; a poem; a tale told in verse.
definitions.example: Tennyson’s rhymes

definitions.definition: A word that rhymes with another.
definitions.example: Norse poetry is littered with rhymes like "sól ... sunnan".

definitions.definition: Rhyming: sameness of sound of part of some words.
definitions.example: The poem exhibits a peculiar form of rhyme.

definitions.definition: Rime
Number.
To compose or treat in verse; versify.
(followed by with) Of a word, to be pronounced identically with another from the vowel in its stressed syllable to the end.
definitions.example: "Creation" rhymes with "integration" and "station".

definitions.definition: Of two or more words, to be pronounced identically from the vowel in the stressed syllable of each to the end of each.
definitions.example: "India" and "windier" rhyme with each other in non-rhotic accents.

definitions.definition: To number; count; reckon.
The digit/figure 5.
definitions.example: He wrote a five followed by four zeroes.

definitions.definition: A banknote with a denomination of five units of currency. See also fiver.
definitions.example: Can anyone here change a five?

definitions.definition: Anything measuring five units, as length.
definitions.example: All the fives are over there in the corner, next to the fours.

definitions.definition: A person who is five years old.
definitions.example: The fives and sixes will have a snack first, then the older kids.

definitions.definition: Five o'clock.
definitions.example: See you at five.

definitions.definition: A short rest, especially one of five minutes.
definitions.example: Take five, soldier.

definitions.definition: A basketball team, club or lineup.
A ball game, somewhat like tennis, played against a wall.
A pair of fives.
The cells located on the fourth floor.
A problem affecting function.
definitions.example: They are still trying to work out all the glitches.

definitions.definition: An unexpected behavior in an electrical signal, especially if the signal spontaneously returns to expected behavior after a period of time.
A bug or an exploit.
definitions.example: Performing this glitch gives you extra lives.

definitions.definition: A genre of experimental electronic music since the 1990s, characterized by a deliberate use of sonic artifacts that would normally be viewed as unwanted noise.
(especially of machines) To experience an intermittent, unexpected, malfunction.
definitions.example: My computer keeps glitching; every couple of hours it just reboots without warning.

definitions.definition: To perform an exploit or recreate a bug while playing a video game.
definitions.example: His character will glitch into the wall and out of the level.

definitions.definition: A slow-paced Cuban partner dance in 4:4 time.
To dance the rumba
To apply a pattern.
To make or design (anything) by, from, or after, something that serves as a pattern; to copy; to model; to imitate.
To follow an example.
To fit into a pattern.
To serve as an example for.
Conformed to a pattern, a model to be followed.
definitions.example: The Royal Navy kept patterned birches and patterned canes at the principal dockyards as specimens, intending to standardize the main implements used for formal corporal punishment on its ships

definitions.definition: Supplied with a pattern
A man's formal hat, with a tall cylindrical crown (often of silk).
A kind of steel batten.
(chiefly in the plural) A tiny piece of bread, either one that falls from bread as it is cut or eaten, or one made deliberately by crumbling bread.
(chiefly in the plural) A single link in a chain indicating the hierarchical location of a web page or similar, used as a navigation aid.
To sprinkle breadcrumbs on to food, normally before cooking.
To add navigational breadcrumbs to (a web page or user interface).
To use clues or enticements to lead someone in the desired direction.
(games) A children's game in which each person in a line replicates the actions of the one in front.
The period or season of summer.
A large shrub of the genus Syringa, especially Syringa vulgaris, bearing white, pale-pink or purple flowers.
A flower of the lilac shrub.
(color) A pale purple color, the color of some lilac flowers.
Having a pale purple colour.
A northern Italian dessert consisting of flavoured double cream set with gelatine, often served with fruit sauce or caramel syrup.
The totality of blogs, especially the unique jargons, cultures and shared interests created by their interconnection.
A large, flat piece of solid material; a solid object that is large and flat.
A paving stone; a flagstone.
A carton containing 24 cans of beer.
An outside piece taken from a log or timber when sawing it into boards, planks, etc.
A bird, the wryneck.
The slack part of a sail.
A large, luxury pre-1980 General Motors vehicle, particularly a Buick, Oldsmobile or Cadillac.
A very large wave.
A sequence of 12 adjacent bits, serving as a byte in some computers.
Part of a tectonic plate that is being subducted.
To make something into a slab.
Mud, sludge.
Thick; viscous.
A car that has been modified with equipment such as loudspeakers, lights, special paint, hydraulics, and other accessories.
To release from the status of colony; to allow a colony to become independent.
A state legislature (of one of the fifty United States), or government generally, or the building that houses it.
A house built and operated by the government, usually of relatively low price and lived in by people on low incomes.
One who teases.
A single act of teasing.
One who deliberately arouses others (usually men) sexually with no intention of satisfying that arousal.
To separate the fibres of a fibrous material.
To comb (originally with teasels) so that the fibres all lie in one direction.
To back-comb.
To poke fun at.
To provoke or disturb; to annoy.
To manipulate or influence the behavior of, especially by repeated acts of irritation.
To entice, tempt.
To show as forthcoming, in the manner of a teaser.
A powerful and influential person.
The combination of two or more well-known brands for marketing purposes, to strengthen one another's preference or purchase intentions, or to reach a broader audience.
A specific cracker made of graham flour, developed in the nineteenth century.
(by extension) A sweet rectangular cracker, usually made of graham flour and sweetened with honey (and often spiced with cinnamon) and perforated down the middle.
(grammar) An element of the predicate of a sentence which supplements the subject or object by means of the verb. Predicatives may be nominal or adjectival.
(grammar) In some languages, a special part of speech used as a predicate and denoting a state of being.

(grammar, of an adjectival or nominal phrase) Modifying a noun while in a predicate phrase, which predicate phrase is other than the noun phrase and occurs after a verb, as a predicate; contrasted with attributive.
definitions.example: In the sentence, ‘This house is big’, ‘big’ is predicative, whereas in ‘This is a big house’, it is attributive.

definitions.definition: One crowned with laurel, such as a poet laureate or Nobel laureate.
A graduate of a university.
To honor with a wreath of laurel, as formerly was done in bestowing a degree at English universities.
(sometimes postpositive) Crowned, or decked, with laurel.
(of a drug) Which alters the way someone's mind works
To write below or under; subscribe.
To subscribe (a document, policy etc.) with one's name.
To sign; to put one's name to.
To agree to pay by signing one's name; subscribe.
Specifically, to assume financial responsibility for something, and guarantee it against failure.
To act as an underwriter.
To support, lend support to, guarantee the basis of.
To submit to; put up with.
